perhaps with a sound alert when connecting data is coming in?
I would say that each trip has about 10 minutes of play, so at important connection stopes (hubs, terminals) drivers will wait up to like 3 minutes for connecting buses...
maybe if there is another bus within a certain proximity, it would display it
Could we send an auditory alert (such as a beep) to encourage the bus driver to look at the console for information about late busses/route changes.
if every bus driver is willing to wait 3 minutes
then a bus that is subsequently connecting to it would have to wait at least 3 minutes 1 second to connect to it
I don't know if an audiable alert is necessary.
Wait a bus driver will wait 3 minutes at a stop - won't that really mess up the system
it would lead to a pushing back of times
if they're already late, then it would make them later
If they are already late they wouldn't need to wait
that's kind of why I figured it would be a good thing to let the driver know how far behind the bus is, so he could just make an informed decision
that pushing back of times would mess up people who had checked the schedule an hour before
Well the instand that they are waiting 3 minutes, they are late
I wouldn't expect the bus driver to wait more than 30 seconds. But if the system will display busses up to 3 minutes late allowing the bus driver to choose.
if it's 5 seconds behind (ie around the corner), he could just wait. if it's 5 minutes, don't bother.
Yeah,
my thinking is that the whole system would work best if we rely on the driver's judgement on whether to wait for a connecting bus
does the system even know when a bus is late? I'm confused about this
so the onboard system won't remind the driver to wait if he is already late?
we can inform them of how late the connecting bus is and let them decide
yeah, it's supposed to kia

their judgement whether to wait or not
yeah
and 3 minutes is too long to wait
for sure
